reviewText:
The Tales game have always been JRPGs with a capital J.

So I went into this game, fully expecting motivational platitudes, every fight doing double duty as a metaphor for some metaphysical struggle, and unneccessary romantic tension. You know... the good stuff.

What I got instead, was a 40 hour ride of word barf, vaguelly directed at the viewer.


One of the characters defining trait is, quite literally, that she can't talk about anything relevant to the plot if it could serve to minimize unneccessary drama. And why is that? MAGIC!
Indeed, for as many times as MAGIC has to rescue the plot from whatever corner it has currently driven itself into, it's a miracle that the main character isn't named Copperfield.


I stopped playing the game, after having to sit through a half hour cut-scene which, if the music and cinematography was anything to go by, was supposed to be a the big climatic pre-final battle recap of whatever the heroes learned on their journey. For 30 minutes the characters talked non-stop, delievering one non-sequitur after the other, as long as it sounded even mildly philosophical. And having said absolutely nothing at all, the game then proceeded to show fireworks, like a child who thinks it won an argument by saying Nuhu
date:
you're stupid!".


That is the big theme of the game: The Creators obviously wanted to raise some big questions about sacrifice
hoursPlayed: and what is neccessary to gain peace
voteText: but never stopped to consider that at some point they also would have to present answers to those questions."

reviewText:
I just completed this game!
I really wish I could give a more postive review however there is just to many issues.
As a tales player. (Graces,Symphonia,Vesperia,XIllia and xillia 2) I found this game unsatisifying.
(warning mechanic spoilers ahead. But no story spoilers)

Pros-
Over 45 hours of gameplay garenteed.

Armisomething - It's a cool concept. But again. You get 2-4 ARTES. per armisilation. Yep. Your just using auto attacks or the same spell OVER. AND OVER AND OVER again.

I..  i can't honestly think of anything else



Cons
Lack of artes. - In all other tales games you'd get an array of artes ( see rita mordio art exhibition on you tube) on this game however you get 7-11 artes each. This is EXTREMELY dispointing as it makes combat dull and repeative.

Uninteresting characters - Besides Edna who has a unique personality everyone is just plain and bland.

Lack of character development - Yeah. This is a big one. The characters do not develop. They litterally are like  hey. Let's do this for no reason. Oh The world needs saving? better not give a back story" I cried in nearly every tales game. But i felt no emotional connectivity for this game. Considering it's a Rpg. 60% of the game became dead to me.

Mystic artes are a let down - The artes in this game are not flashy at all. Ranging from 1.3-4 seconds of animation. with little to pathetic damage. In most instances it's really not worth using it as to save your party from dieing.

Lack of devil arms - Yeah you heard me. No devil arms. Just some paper weaponry that has zero stats. Can't scale and you can only equip skills on it. ( which trust me
date:
only means 10% increase on damage or so. really worth equipping a higher tier weapon)

Seperah - Yeah. The magical beings are a huge let down. They are litterally just humans. I don't know how characters can tell them apart. They don't have any physical features that let you know they are devine beings. Come on namco atleast give them elf ears or something!

In conclusion: If you played all the previous tales games go for it. it's going to be a long wait for the next game but please please please consider getting a previous titles. the gameplay is less grapical then xillia and less interesting then paint drying. sorry to say of course."

reviewText:
An abomination in Tales family, much more like ff13. For that price I definetly can not recomend.
+ Surprisly well-made port
- Past-gen graphics (+beautiful color pallet)
+ Story has interesting subjects in it like  interpritation of human vices as malevolence
- They aren't developed well

- But it's totally flat
- Chraracters acting like children. Especially such behaviour is strange for Rose, who is serving in assassin's guild
+ Combat has many twists and turns
- It's overly complex, arcane and no matter what tactic you will choose, everything will boil down to button mashing
- Upgrade/equipment system is utter ♥♥♥♥ and can rival ff13 from this point.

reviewText: It has a pretty typical fantasy adventure anime-type story and has enjoyable characters. The skits and the soundtracks at times make the game seem better than it is. However, the gameplay is very boring. The combat is okay, but you spend a lot of time walking around from place to place. You do this until you are able to save-point travel, but even dungeons have a lot of pointless walking. A lot of the areas are really empty and are just big for no apparent reason. The AI is also very terrible for your teammates. They do the most stupid things and do not follow commands a lot of the time. The camera in combat is also terrible. You can't control the camera manually during combat and it tends to point towards walls and you are unable to see what is going on until you reposition your character. In conclusion, I would not reccomend this game for the current price, it should have been priced around $15 rather than $50.

reviewText: This game was released in a broken state. I and many others were unable to even get into the game due to multiple game-crashing bugs that hit you right at the start. In my case, I ran into the language select bug - every time you start the game, you have to select what language the audio is in, but if you have an audio set-up that the game doesn't like (in my case, surround 7.1 which i couldn't change) the game will crash immediately after the options pop up.\n\nI waited a week and this still was not fixed, so I got a refund. DO NOT buy this game until this is fixed (check the forum to be sure). I doubt I will even then.

reviewText:
I'm very mixed about this game, but feel a little more towards a negative side.

On one hand, I like the combat that comes with a Tales game and all the character interaction. I like the idea of being able to customize your party's clothing and hair. The new system where you combine with seraph and gain special powers is a cool idea. The newest Tales game I played was Tales of the Abyss, so the new way to get around the map is appealing. I think if you can't find a decent newer game to play, this might be for you.

But on the other hand, I personally think the characters are very flat and hard to get attached to. Like I said before, I like character interaction, but there is a ridiculous amount of cutscenes in this game so far. I find myself zoning out whenever a cutscene plays now. The main story of the Shepard's duty and defeating malevolence is good and all, but that side mission about following your dreams" and exploring ruins to keep the main character happy is pretty lame. It doesn't even seem like the main character and his life-long friend are that excited about ruins now. Also
date: the characters joining the party did mention their reasons
recommended: but they still seemed so complacent about devoting themselves to a cause and putting their life on the line.\n\ntl;dr For me

reviewText:
I'm quite honestly surprised at how many positive reviews this game has. After playing Vesperia and Symphonia, I have a decent standard for the tales series and this game doesn't come anywhere close to it. So here is my opinion on the game after 7 hours before uninstalling it.

Pros:
- Cover art is pretty.
- Skit quality and their full body animations were the freshest thing about this game. (Crache)

Cons:
- The story is hard to play through because it's so bland and predictable.
(I feel like I'm gonna sleep for 3 days ohwowIsleptfor3dayswhathappened.)

- None of these characters that you meet or play have any depth to them.
(Except Sorey. He's got feathers for earrings wow.)

- Overworld design is so empty that it's depressing.
(But don't worry because there's some completely not-out-of-place glowing Saffron next to this bush.)

- Monolith placement and their exceptional skill at awkwardly breaking the 4th wall.
(Ancient words of wisdom is to not buy this game.)

- The camera in combat is frustrating especially if you're in a dungeon hallway.
(Where am I)

- The equipment skill system is so unnecessary and cluttered.
(Difens -> Defense)

- Combat is all about spamming your armament until you see 'Power Hit' appear.
(Up on the d-pad isn't the answer. Try left.)

- Post-combat dialogue is cringe-worthy.
(Purification Complete!)

- Trying to hit an enemy to start a pre-emptive attack is frustrating when your hitbox is at elbow length.
(SuperSneakyA+yeah)

- Every NPC has 1 of 2 designs. Brown/White shirt with Brown/White Pants. Or a Royal Knight.
(Ctrl + C, Ctrl + V)

- The name Shepherd"
(Seriously?)

Verdict:
I would rather spend this money on cheese sticks. At least cheese sticks would keep me in suspense of whether or not the cheese was melted."

reviewText:
After not playing the past 2 Tales games in the series, I choose to pick up this one.  What a waste of money, a huge disappointment.

-------Negatives:

Constant interupts of ingame cutscenes that take away the control of your character for trivial dialog that doesn't progress the plot.  Ever watch an Anime and find yourself skipping ahead 2-4 seconds to get past boring ♥♥♥♥?  You'll be doing that a lot in this game.  Mashing X to ship 20 lines of meaningless dialog.

Animation of so poor for a $55 usd game thats been in development for 2+ years...  with the past experience of previous Tales games.  Main character walks/runs like theres something wrong with him.  Water flows in ways physically impossible.  Lifeless actors in the world, unblinking eyes.  Limited facial expression in dialog,  THE UNCANNY VALLY is strong in this game!

The story, good god the story.  The hero of the game is an ordinary human that lives among the invisable guardians of the realm.  Why? Who cares!  The evil returns to the world, and a new saviour must be chosen.  Why?  Who cares!  Plot!  Our human main character assumes the burden of being the new saviour because he's a good guy and wants to save humanity!  He doesn't do a THING to earn the blessing of guardians.  Maybe 20m after being branded the Saviour he aquires the ability to go ♥♥♥♥ing SUPER SAIYAN after fighting a pack of blob/slim monsters that are literally of no threat to him.  He does NOTHING to earn this incredible power thats ment to save the world.  And this all happens in the FIRST ♥♥♥♥ING HOUR OF THE GAME.

The game does nothing to ease you into an unnessesary complex combat system, and has all avenues of difficulty thrown at your face 20% into the game.  I understand they do this so you grow into it so your prepared for tough battles when they hit you .  It's overwhelming and unnessesary, especially considering combat mechanics of past Tales games.

Want to play the game in English?  Prepair to laugh your ♥♥♥ off, while cringing until your face stays that way.  It's dreadful, missmatched voices everywhere.  A cultural difference not accounted for.

-------Positives:

The art is stellar.  The textures of the assets in the world not so much, but the backdrops in the world are beautiful.  The starting area when you begin is up in the clouds, I got lost in the scenary right from the start.

reviewText:
All in all very boring game.

Bad things: Poor story, uninteresting characters, uninteresting boss fights that dont give you any sence of acomplishment even when you beat tham on hardest seting while powerd up, repetitive combat, poor ai,no need to set strategy at all, annoying camera , alot of walking, lack of world exploration, feels like youre on 1 small island going from 1 village to other village, alot of tutorial. Fusion system at first sounds like huge pain since i got overwhelmed with so much info , i spent alot of time just reading about it on web so i can ace it, which sadly was just a huge waste of time since you will only need to deal with fusion for the last boss and you only need dragon slaying capabilitys combined with seraphs respective element to roflstom him into the ground, on the other hand if you like to waste alot of time to make uber gear which might take you few days to make just so you can kill him several seconds sooner have fun with that. I was hyped about fusion , i figured there would be alot of optional super hard bosses that could be only wasted by creating special set of gear for each of tham but sadly no. My second playthrugh combat tactic was instant cast fire armatized hidden arts spamage.( right click, right click , right click so yea BORING)

Good stuff: skits , music, normins trying to hump seraphs leg, failed cooking comments, watching ai geting killed over and over again if you can find some fun in that as i did.

I got two games for the price of 1 so back than this wasnt such a bad deal i guess . If youre the person that likes to min/max stuff than this is the game for you. If you want story rich game which you wont forget in 2 weeks than you wont find that here. I hope in the future they will add dlc with rly hard optional bosses that will need some heavy gear perparation and hopefully bosses wont be huge lumps of hp.

reviewText: Don't buy this game unless it's on a deep discount. Broadcasting is Disabled
date:
they tell you. What they mean is, we're going to lock you out of the game, and maybe you can continue playing if you kick people out of the broadcast channel. It's a 50/50 of whether a restart is required.

The mouse control is poor. It's way too sensitive on 2/5 sensitivity setting, and feels super sluggish on 1/5. Input timing is off too: it always feels like I have to input long before anything happens.

There are bad view issues with combat, and frankly, the combat doesn't live up to the former games in the series.

On a positive note, the intro video is awesome. Story is interesting, even if sometimes you want to slap a character for saying something foolish and pointless.
